header.topics: Linguistics recording, friends, pregnancy, reunions, colloquialisms, post, chores, money and budgets, salary, marriage, joint bank accounts, South Korea, education, TV, shopping, weather, childbirth, children, future plans, living abroad, university, form filling, accent, Spanish, cigarettes, cost of living, old jobs,
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, complaining, advising, announcing, anecdote telling, telling jokes

body.u: yeah I'm doing it now so I'm getting paid to do erm record the British public basically so
anyone British I can record so you you're British aren't you?
erm I have been since I was born
how are you getting paid to do that though?

er it's Cambridge University Press they're like collecting a corpus of information so a few years back they made one of like written words so like a hundred or three hundred million written words or something was the corpus
now they wanna make a a spoken one
so they need peop freelancers around the country to like record people for every hour I record I get eighteen pounds so it's
oh well so I can record as well?
yeah any any British person I mean I don't know about you getting paid you might need to get in contact with them yourself but I'm I've signed a contract I'm like a registered freelancer with them
so yeah so I need you to sign some disclosure
how did you how did you find out about that?
it was posted on Su on University of Sussex Linguistics Department website
so I was just on there like having a look around and saw this job advert and went on yeah that would be sweet
and that pays me mate and until next June we can get infinite amount of recordings until next June
and get paid for it yeah
but you can't presumably just record a load of silence
we can't stop talking any time there's a
that should be alright for you though

no no no about three hours is and me the rest is my family and friends
and everyone I see you know what I mean? some friends are better to record than others
is always going on about whatever he stole or whatever he did so

is it a bit dodgy then?
well is he still in the army no?

that's quite good for every hour isn't it?
it's a bloody bargain yeah I mean there's more work I have to like I think it's gonna get increasingly difficult to record people as time goes on

obviously they don't just want the same people over and over
can't you just stick it in a pub or something?
a pub would be a great people to have it but you need people's permission don't you that's the only thing

pretty much if I have your permission

a bit of cigarettes or something
yeah like that kind of stuff but apart from that we wanna go and see people or do anything we need to earn

worth you know what I mean? to say to people unlimited until next June that's a bit crazy

well I mean it's been alright I mean you know she's got the cart blanch to be in a mood right

bloody hell as soon as I come home and six years later you're gonna be a dad
